content.question: Which of the following is true of monopolistically competitive firms in long-run equilibrium?

choices.label: Firms can earn positive economic profits.
Firms face a perfectly elastic demand curve.
Price equals marginal cost, which equals marginal revenue.
Price will always be above average total cost.
Marginal revenue equals marginal cost, and price equals average total cost.

content.answer: Marginal revenue equals marginal cost, and price equals average total cost.
